Learn to code
Learn how to code through challenges, games, or even personal projects.

To get started, you can:

check out what we have!

Resources

  • Learning
  • Practicing
Codecademy

Stories and courses for developers! Many of the courses offered are free!

CodePath

No cost coding courses, mentorship, and career support!

Microsoft Education

Free course modules and access to developer tools that are free for students (ex. Azure)



Major League Hacking

MLH is the homebase for hundreds of hackathons every year. Visit their website and find your next hackathon!

GeeksForGeeks

A website filled with articles, tutorials on different languages, practice problems, interview prep, and more!

Google AI

Different courses and videos about machine learning!



Cognitive Class

Free courses about leading technologies with certification!

Coursera

Free online courses in *Blockchain*, cybersecurity and all the programming languages you could ask for.

Harvard CS50

Free intro to computer science course offered by Harvard. This course is self-paced and fully online.



Coderbyte

Visit Coderbyte to access a library of coding challenges, interview kits, and starter courses.

Teach Yourself CS

A website full of different videos, lectures, and books regarding different CS subjects (also has translations).

Frontend Mentor

Practice front end web development by creating actual projects.



CS Dojo

YouTube channel that has videos and how to program as well as practice for interview questions!

Stanford Engineering Everywhere

Access to lectures, coursework, and materials from Stanford engineering courses.

MIT OpenCourseWare

Access to lectures, coursework, and materials from MIT courses.



Class Central

Find a variety of online CS and data science courses!

Coderwall

Collaborative learning platform with tips, knowledge, and tools for a variety of programming languages.

Codrops

Blog focused on front-end web development and web design with articles about web development and design techniques.



Major League Hacking

MLH is the homebase for hundreds of hackathons every year. Visit their website and find your next hackathon!

Coderbyte

Visit Coderbyte to access a library of coding challenges, interview kits, and starter courses.

Cracking the Coding Interview

A book of coding problems with hints and solutions. You can find it for free on your local library app Libby.



HackerRank

Most known for its use in technical interviews, HackerRank is among the top ranked sites for coding practice.

LeetCode

A website where people practice their coding skills. With 800+ questions and growing, each with multiple solutions.

CodePen

Build, test, and discover front-end code!



GeeksForGeeks

A website filled with articles, tutorials on different languages, practice problems, interview prep, and more!

CodinGame

The CodinGame platform gives programmers games to practice coding AND get noticed by recruiters.

Pramp

A website where you can do live mock interviews with a peer!



CodeWars

Improve your development skills through coding challenges, and utilize the talent match program to find possible career opportunities.

CSS Battle

CSS Battle allows you to master CSS one topic at a time.

Daily Coding Problem

Subscribe to a mailing list that sends a coding problem to your email inbox every day!



Devpost

Devpost allows you to look at upcoming hackathons as well as hackathons on specific topics or catered to different coding levels.

Networking Academy

Free programming classes in different programming languages!



Contact Us


This site is only possible through the efforts of students and educators like you. If you have a resource you think could be added to the page, an idea for a page on TransparenCS, or any critiques, suggestions, funny memes, questions, or poems, please contact us!
